intro: Centaurea foucauldiana, commonly known as the Foucauld's cornflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring blue to purple petals and a dense, spiky central cone. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are upright and branched. Centaurea foucauldiana thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry meadows and rocky areas.
